turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Okay, Dad.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: If anyone asks about Simone --

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: -- I know, I don't know anything.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Exactly.  Don't you wonder where I'm really hiding Simone?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I'm sure you'd tell me if you thought it was important.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: One thing bothered me.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I know, Hal is as stiff as always.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: No, not that.  I was just wondering -- in the bedroom scene in reel two why did Simone have no reflection when she walked in front of that mirror?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: So that accounts for the lack of a shadow in reel six?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Precisely.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Good-night, Daddy.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Night, Lainey.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Hey, Lainey.  How's your love life?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I do okay.  How about you?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You know me -- married to my work.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I noticed.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Dad, you know I don't like to get between you and mom but she's feeling down right now.  She broke up with Kent.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Really?  Too bad.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: She thinks you're with Simone.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Lainey, you know Simone and I don't have a real relationship.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I know but Mom doesn't.  Maybe if it came from Simone, if Simone spoke to Mom -- she could straighten things out.  Dinner, maybe.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Dinner?  Dinner's difficult.  A phone call?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Too impersonal.  They have to meet face-to-face.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'll see what I can do.  You know, Lainey.  I don't believe you've ever once asked to meet Simone.  Don't you like her?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I love her but that doesn't mean I need to meet her.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I love you, Lainey.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I love you too, daddy.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Why didn't she thank you?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: She did... didn't she?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Happy birthday, Lainey.  Do you like it?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: It's fantastic -- it's too much.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: It's the car she drove in "Eternity Forever".

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: I know.  Thank her for me.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: It's from both of us.  Of course you'll have to drive it around the lot until you get your permit --

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: -- I can't accept it.  I don't want a car, Dad.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Why not?  I can get you something else.  What do you want?

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: The old Viktor Taransky.  I liked you better before -- before all this.  You were a loser, Dad, but at least you had integrity.  I can't stand to see you like this -- clinging to Simone's coattails -- it used to be about the work, and now it's all about her.  And then she's not even grateful enough to thank you.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No, that was me.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: There you go again, blaming yourself.  Can't you see what she's done to you -- she's taking advantage, mocking you.  You deserve better than Simone.  I've got to go, Dad.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Lainey...

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: About you and mom?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Me and Simone.  What I did.

turns.speaker: LAINEY
turns.text: Your mistake wasn't making something fake, daddy.  We're fine with fake -- as long as you don't lie about it.

turns.speaker: LAWYER
turns.text: -- Plead guilty and throw yourself on the mercy of the court.  It's the best deal you're going to get.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I could get the death penalty.

turns.speaker: LAWYER
turns.text: You certainly will if you go to trial -- a jury in this kind of ugly mood.  You've killed an icon, for God's sake.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I didn't kill anyone, Bernard, there was no one to kill!

turns.speaker: LAWYER
turns.text: An insanity defence.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- No!  I can't go along with this horseshit!  Just tell them they can fry me!

turns.speaker: LAWYER
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: It was premeditated -- I knew exactly what I was doing!  I strangled her!  I bludgeoned her! I set her on fire!  I did it!  I killed her!

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Do I know you?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Max Sayer -- National Echo.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Don't you have a real story to write?  Why aren't you in Latin America?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: This is the story.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I remember when the Echo had class -- the paper that could bring down governments.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Our leaders aren't presidents anymore -- they're pop stars and screen idols.  If Woodward and Bernstein were alive today, they'd be right here in Hollywood with me.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: They are alive, Sayer.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So they're probably here.  You might be able to sell this 'disappearing act' to the rest of the world, but I'm not buying it. What's really behind this Simone woman?  The public has a right to know.  Why is she staying out of sight?  And why the hell is she with you?  I don't want you to take this the wrong way, Viktor, but you're not exactly Cecil B. DeMille -- more run-of-the-mill.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Maybe the reason she's with me is a little thing called integrity, Sayer.  Look it up.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She sounds like a prisoner, Taransky.  Are you holding her hostage?  Are you some kind of Svengali?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Who's the hostage, Sayer, her or you?  You look kind of "captive" yourself.  While you're spending every waking hour obsessing over Simone, guess what, I guarantee she doesn't even know you exist.  Get off my property or I'll call the cops.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The cops?  The cops read my column to know who to bust.  We're the only watchdog the public has.  None of this is going away.  We'll be here tomorrow and the day after that.  Until you slip up.  And you will.  You are looking at your shadow.  Because all these elaborate precautions with Simone -- every instinct in my body tells me, it's not natural.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'm just trying to help you, Sayer. I don't want you to be disappointed.  It gets cold out here at night.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Nice try.  If we can't get to her through you, maybe your family will be more co-operative.  I can guarantee you, Taransky, one way or another, Miss Simone and I are going to get acquainted.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'd like to see that, Sayer. Invite me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Nice boat, Taransky.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: It's a yacht.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I know what you're up to.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I don't have time for this, Sayer.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I think you do.  I know it's a fake.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's bogus.  You used an old library shot for the background.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: The background is.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She was never in New Mexico.  She never left the studio.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I've done my homework.  I've studied her.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- I bet you have.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: -- I've looked at every piece of publicity she's ever done, the video in the supermarket, there's no evidence she's ever left the studio.  Oh, and for some reason this woman leaves no paper trail.  But I have "obtained" a copy of your bank accounts.  I know you have power of attorney but so far you haven't transferred one single solitary cent to her.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'm keeping it in trust.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I know that's what you'd like us to believe.  But I got to tell you -- embezzlement is a serious matter. Not to mention abduction.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Abduction?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't buy the whole recluse scam. How are you doing it?  What is it -- drugs?  Blackmail?  Mind-control? All three?  What do you do -- keep her locked in a box somewhere?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: What is it exactly you want, Sayer?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I want to see her.  Unless you show me Simone live and in person I show these pictures to the authorities.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Alright, Sayer, you've got a deal.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Er,... good.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: What now, Sayer?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Looks familiar, doesn't she?  No one comes from nowhere, Taransky. You turn over enough rocks...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I traced her to a nursing home.  A young woman fitting Simone's description dropped her off five years ago.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: She looks a lot like you.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She hasn't uttered a word that whole time -- until she saw the big show.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That doesn't prove a thing -- wait until I get a court order for a blood test.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: That won't be necessary.  Sooner or later I knew you'd crack this thing, Max.  You got me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I do?  Sure I do.  Can we speak off the record?  I'm a fair man.  I'm willing to sit down with her and tell her side of the story.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I wouldn't want you to compromise your ethics.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: No.  Thanks.  Absolutely.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You love her, don't you, Max?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Don't you?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: This should take care of Mother.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Is it a jamming device?

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Maybe he's talking to himself.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Taransky isn't that good an actor. No, they're taking special precautions.  Some kind of new encryption.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Whatever it is, it's dark.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Dark?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yes, very.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: We've got our best people on it, Mr. Sayer.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: 24-hour tail on Taransky?

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Shutter bugs camped outside any place he goes, every concierge and maitre d' on the take.  But this Simone woman is good.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Obviously the name isn't real -- she's using an assumed identity, travels under a false name, checks into hotels with an alias.  She never stays in the same place two nights in a row.  Anything on the satellite photos?  What about the fingerprints?  What happened when we dusted that hotel suite?

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Well, we got some of Taransky's fingerprints, a lot of your fingerprints... but none of hers.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Which means they're significant.  Incriminating.  Perhaps, criminal.  She's hiding her past.  She's hiding her past.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Of course -- no one's that perfect, that pure.  You know I had something on Mother Teresa.  But then she died and it wasn't worth it anymore.  I know how to flush out this Simone -- a tell-all story from her childhood.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: My God, you've got one?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I will when you're finished writing it.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Am I wasting my time with you? When she sues to protect her privacy, she'll have to appear in a public courtroom to do it.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Long live the First Amendment.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Sometimes you have to tell a small lie to get to the bigger truth.  As for a photo -- if you can't do it, I know twelve million people who can.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Mr. Sayer...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What do you want -- ?

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Mr. Sayer, did we pay the million bucks yet?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: -- Cashier's check went out to our anonymous tipster this morning -- worth every penny too.  Who says there's no place for checkbook journalism?  We'll be running stills of this for months, then release the whole tape -- we'll get our money back -- maybe show it on an exclusive pay-per-view event. Do you realize what we have here? We have the only independent footage of Simone in existence.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: We used to.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: -- I've been here before! -- On my honeymoon with my ex-wife.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Is that why she left you?

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: It's a hotel.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: MILTON
turns.text: Could they have built that hotel since yesterday?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- Nicola!  How was your massage?

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: You're in breach.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: -- Is this about the new pages? -- I made the changes you wanted, you're in virtually every scene --

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: It's not the size of the role, Viktor.  Am I or am I not contractually entitled to the biggest trailer on the set?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: It's the biggest on earth!  I swear!  It's a 50-foot Airstream -- they don't make them any longer than that.

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: Taller, Viktor.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Taller?  What?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I beg you.  You can't do this to me.

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: I had three other offers.  I only signed on to this picture out of... loyalty.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Then show some.  They'll shut me down!

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: It wasn't working anyhow.  The scene with the thousand geese -- I don't understand this film.  I don't think anyone will understand it.  I already put out a press release -- citing "creative differences".

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: A lot's happened since we last saw each other.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: I never apologized properly for what happened on "Sunrise".

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Thank you.  It's not important.

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: After I saw what Simone did with the role -- you know I fired all my people, went into rehab, took acting classes, changed my whole look.  She really inspired me.

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: Would you like me to read?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Yes, I'd like that.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You know you're really very good. I take back what I said.  I mean, you're really good.

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You could play the lead.

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: But that's Simone's part.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Yes, of course it is.  You know you have a line here.  Not a wrinkle.  Actually, more of a dimple.  I've been thinking of incorporating something like that in Simone.

turns.speaker: NICOLA
turns.text: You'd cosmetically alter Simone to look like me?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No, of course not, you're right. That would be crazy.

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
turns.text: No one came in or went out just like you said, Mr. Taransky.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
turns.text: Is Miss Simone coming today?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: She's already here.  She arrived before you and she'll leave long after you've gone.  Remember, under no circumstances are you or any other person to enter the set without my express permission.

turns.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
turns.text: What if it catches on fire?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Let it burn.  Simone would rather go up in flames than give up her privacy.

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Perfect.  God, I'm so relaxed around you.

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: I'll do anything to please you, Mr. Taransky.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I'm sorry, I didn't catch that. What did you say?

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: I'll do anything to please you, Mr. Taransky.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Simone, are you there?

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: I certainly am, Mr. Taransky.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Let's take it down a notch.

turns.speaker: SIMONE
turns.text: -- What you don't understand --

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Good morning, Simone.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: Good morning, Mr. Taransky.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: A star is...

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: ... digitized.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: You mean they buy it?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Buy it?  They're paying for it. And around here that's how you really know they buy it.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: Maybe he can.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Do you have any idea what this means, Simone?  Our ability to manufacture fraud now exceeds our ability to detect it.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: I am the death of real.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You are birth of... what?  A Phenomenon.  A miracle.  A new era in show business.  All I wanted to do was finish the film.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: And now look what you've started. And now look what you've started. And now look what you've started.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: Is that better, Mr. Taransky?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Yes.  Yes, it is.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: You did create me.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: No.  I... just helped bring someone else's dream to life.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: Mr. Taransky, we both know I was nothing without you.  I was computer code -- ones and zeros.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: You're right.  You're right.  Of course, one doesn't want to boast. It's a classic case of technology in search of an artist.  That's all you've been waiting for, an artist with integrity, with a vision, who can see.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: See beyond that irrational allegiance to flesh and blood. -- See that with the rise in price of a real actor and the fall in price of a fake, the scales have tipped in favor of the fake.  -- See that if the performance is genuine, it doesn't matter if the actor is real.  Once a performance is committed to film, the blood and bones are gone anyway.  Only the spirit, the illusion remains. Besides, what's real anymore? These days most actors have digital work done to them so it's a gray area.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: Are you ever going to tell the truth about me, Mr. Taransky?

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: The only real truth is in the work.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: You know what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Yes.  Yes, I'm going to tell the truth about you, why wouldn't I...?  Of course, with Hank's tragic passing, the secret died with him.  I am going to tell the truth... after your next picture.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Speaking of which -- this is the project I'd like you to do next.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: Not, "Eternity Forever"?  The legendary unproduced script that was too good ever to get made?  I'd kill for that part.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: I was hoping you'd say that.

turns.speaker: SIMONE / VIKTOR
turns.text: You're going to get in a lot of trouble, Mr. Taransky.

turns.speaker: VIKTOR
turns.text: Why do you have to bring that up? There's always risk -- life's a risk.  It's worth it.  Besides, how could something so lovely be a crime?  Well, I think we've done enough for today.  You've been cooped up in there too long.  How about you and me go out on the town?  They're expecting us.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Mahogany. I'd say that cost at least a couple hundred. Maybe three.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Three? We should hock it. Buy a C.D. rack for the bedroom.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Do you know how important this is? This is big time.  I'm going to read it for you, doctor.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Do I really sound like Dr. Seuss?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Wow. They called you their son.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: We can keep it in the bathroom.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --My God.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: --Do I know you?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Are you calling me?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What? You don't see enough of me at the store?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Why, Malcolm?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What, Anna? What did I do? What's made you so sad?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Why did you leave me?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I didn't leave you.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I just needed to do a couple of things.  And I needed to tell you something.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Goodnight, Malcolm.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Goodnight, sweetheart.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: On my way to the flea market in Amish country. Thought maybe you want to come. Show me how to buy at these things.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I trust you... Besides, I don't know if I'm up for the Amish today. You can't curse or spit or anything around them.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: That's very sweet. I'm okay.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Do you think I should stop by on my way back? Show you what I got? It's not a problem.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You know that's probably not the best idea. I'll just wait to see them in the store.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Okay. Fine. Understood.  I'm off then.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Don't step in the horse manure.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Your eye frames. They don't seem to have any lenses in them.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: They're my dad's. The lenses hurt my eyes.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I knew there was a sound explanation.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What was that you were saying before with your soldiers? Day pro fun.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: ...De profundis clamo ad te domine.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: All your soldiers speak Latin?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: No, just one.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: What were they hiding from?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Oh, lots of things, I suppose. Bad people for one. People who wanted to imprison them. Hurt them.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Nothing bad can happen in a church, right?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I forgot your name.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Dr. Crowe.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You're a doctor. What kind?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I work with young people who might be sad or upset or just want to talk. I try to help them figure things out.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I got an award once. From the Mayor.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Congratulations.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Thank you. It was a long time ago. I've kind of been retired for a while.  You're my very first client back.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You use needles?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Not even little ones that aren't supposed to hurt?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: That's good.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I'm going to see you again, right?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: If it's okay with you?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: And Cole, next time I won't be late for you.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Next time I won't be scared of you.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: We were supposed to draw a picture. Anything we wanted... I drew a man. He got hurt in the neck by another man with a screwdriver.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You saw that on T.V., Cole?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Everybody got upset. They had a meeting. Momma started crying.  I don't draw like that anymore.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: How do you draw now?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I draw people with smiles, dogs running, and rainbows.  They don't have meetings about rainbows.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I guess they don't.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You want to ask me a question?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: See, this is why I lose at poker. Yes, I do have a question.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Private Kinney's wife is really sick -- she has something called a brain anism.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You mean aneurysm.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Yeah, Private Kinney needed to get back safe to take care of her.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Where should I look then, Cole?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Look over there.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I walk this way to school with Tommy Tammisimo.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: He your best buddy?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: He hates me.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You hate him?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You ever tell her about how it is with Tommy?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I don't tell her a thing.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Cause she doesn't look at me like everybody and I don't want her to. I don't want her to know.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Know what?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: That I'm a freak.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You said the "s" word.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Yeah. Sorry.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Mr. Marschal gets real lonely.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What about Mrs. Marschal?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: She died a long time ago.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: ...So your dad lives in Pittsburgh with a lady who works in a toll booth.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: What if she has to pee when she's working? You think she just holds it?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I don't know. I was just thinking the same thing.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What'd you write?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Words.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What kind of words?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Upset words.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Think about what you want from our time together. What our goal should be?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Something I want?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: If we could change something in your life, anything at all, what would you like that to be?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: That isn't magic.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You just kept the penny in that hand the whole time...

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Who me?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I didn't know you were funny.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I forgot myself.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Your father ever tell you bedtime stories?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Once upon a time there was a prince, who was being driven around... He drove around for a long, long time... Driving and driving... It was a long trip... He fell asleep...  When he woke up, they were still driving... The long drive went on--

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Dr. Crowe.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You haven't told bedtime stories before?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You have to add some twists and stuff. Maybe they run out of gas.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: No gas... Hey, that's good.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What makes you think that?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Your eyes told me.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I don't know how the story ends. I hope it's a happy ending.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Dead people, like in graves and coffins?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: No, walking around, like regular people... They can't see each other. Some of them don't know they're dead.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: They don't know they're dead?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: How often do you see them?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: All the time. They're everywhere.  You won't tell anyone my secret, right?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Will you stay here till I fall asleep?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Did you think the play sucked big time?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Tommy Tammisimo acted in a cough syrup commercial. He thought everybody was self-conscious and unrealistic. He said the play sucked big time.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I know every child is special in their own way, but Tommy sounds like a punk.  I thought the play was excellent. Better than Cats.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Cats?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Never mind.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: And the tiny hairs on your arm. Are they all standing up?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: When they get mad, it gets cold.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Them?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Can I ask you then?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: What do you want more than anything?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I told you what I want.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I don't know, Cole.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Why don't you think about it for a while?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I have to.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Soon. One week.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I'm going to transfer you. I know two psychologists that are exceptional--

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Don't fail me.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: --What?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Don't give up. You're the only one who can help me. I know it.
